Key Match Events: Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra gave a brilliant start for New Zealand, scoring 45 and 42 respectively.
Daryl Mitchell (43) gave New Zealand the perfect throttle, ensuring their victory in just 23.2 overs.
Angelo Mathews took 2 wickets, while Dushmantha Chameera and Maheesh Theekshana picked one wicket each for Sri Lanka.
Kusal Perera played wonderfully and slammed the fastest half-century of ICC World Cup 2023 on just 21 balls.
Pre-Game Insights: The NZ vs SL match was a 'do-or-die' for the Black Caps.
New Zealand's Daryl Mitchell in action
Post-Match Reflections: Trent Boult became ‘Player of the Match’
New Zealand thrashed Sri Lanka by 5 wickets with 160 balls remaining and inch closer in ensuring a semi-final berth.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side.
Sri Lanka's tail-end batters held their ground well and took the team to a fightable score of 171 runs.
